data.title: Chief Sustainability Officers List
data.meta_description: Chief sustainability officers (CSOs) list featuring executives who oversee sustainability & net-zero carbon emission business strategies.
data.meta_site_name: Sustainable Tech Partner for Green IT Service Providers
data.text:
DaliaAbdel KaderChief Sustainability OfficerCommercial International Bank (CIB)Abdel Kader's LinkedIn bio states, in part: "Dr Dalia A. Kader is a recognized expert in the fields of sustainable finance and branding. Currently, Dr Kader is Chief Sustainability Officer at Commercial International Bank ( CIB) in Egypt. She is also a Banking Board Member of the UNEP FI Principles for Responsible Banking representing the MENA region. She was Head of the Sustainable Development Committee at the Federation of Egyptian Banks. She is also Co-Founder, Vice Chairman and Board Member of We Owe it to Egypt foundation. She was earlier General Manager and Director of Sustainability & Marketing Communications at Arab African International Bank from 1997-2019. As adjunct professor at the American University in Cairo, she instructed courses on Sustainability Marketing and Egypt: Corporate Responsibility & Social Entrepreneurship for the MBA program in 2013." JaneAbernethyChief Sustainability OfficerHumanscaleAbernethy's LinkedIn bio states: "As Humanscales Chief Sustainability Officer, Jane leads the companys efforts to create a net positive impact through both its products and operations. Collaborating closely with company executives as well as designers and engineers, Jane guides the development process to help create the most sustainable products possible. With an eye on the future, Jane has led and developed sustainability initiatives within Humanscale beginning from her tenure as a Senior Industrial Designer.

An industrial designer by trade, Jane spent over a decade working and leading design teams through the development of new products prior to her role as CSO. Her experience ranges from sporting goods to medical devices to furniture. Her depth of experience in design has been a foundation for developing products that are sustainably assembled and ergonomic for the workplace.

Jane often shares dialogue around sustainable product design and manufacturing at a variety of conferences and events globally, including Greenbuild, World Ocean Conference, and more. She recently applied her expertise as a curator for RECKONstruct, the US Pavilion at the XXII Triennale de Milano International Exhibition: Broken Nature: Design Takes on Human Survival. Janes work has also been recognized internationally, including the prestigious Red Dot award and the GB&D Women in Sustainability Leadership Award. Under her leadership, Humanscale has been recognized as the first manufacturer to achieve the complete Living Product Challenge and is a founding member of the Next Wave Initiative."

AmanahAboobuckerChief Sustainability OfficerAmBank GroupAboobucker's LinkedIn bio states: "Amanah is a senior banking and finance practitioner, with extensive multi-geography experience, over a career spanning 28 years. She is passionate about climate change, ESG and sustainability and is currently the Chief Sustainability Officer of AmBank Group. She is reputed for her leadership skills, ability to drive change, articulate value-adding outcomes and influence strategic direction, working with Boards and Regulators. She is also a member of the Singapore Institute of Directors." JohnAbubakerChief Sustainability OfficerVillanova UniversityAbubaker's LinkedIn bio states: "A sustainability and leadership professional with a proven ability to lead teams to deliver impact at scale. Areas of expertise include sustainability, the circular economy, ethical business, human flourishing, leadership, urban development, and the environment." PrabodhaAcharyaChief Sustainability OfficerJSW GroupAcharya's LinkedIn bio states: "In the current role as the Chief Sustainability Officer for JSW Group, partners with CEOs, Senior Executives, Functional heads and operations heads to develop and drive ESG and sustainability strategy for JSW group companies, support building sustainability/ESG credibility of the group within internal and external stakeholders at national and international level. An experienced professional on Corporate ESG Management, Climate change and sustainability having worked in corporate environmental, safety and health management, emissions reduction, corporate sustainability strategy, ESG Framework and policy advocacy, Sustainable Financing, ESG Rating improvements, Sustainable Branding, third-party verification and assurance Services. I create teams and systems to help organizations meet their ESG obligations and improve their sustainability performance and branding." Antonio BravoAcnGroup Head of Sustainability Strategy and DevelopmentBBVAAccording to his LinkedIn bio, Acn's expertise spans sustainability, banking, technology, transformation strategy, agile at scale, distribution models, innovation, emerging markets, and venture capital. NicolaAcuttChief Sustainability Officer (CSO) and VP of ESGNetAppAcutt's LinkedIn bio states: "Nicola is an experienced business leader with 20+ years driving impact at the intersection of business, technology, and sustainability. Nicola was recently named NetApp's first Chief Sustainability Officer for the data infrastructure company based in San Jose. With expertise in environmental science, sustainability strategy, climate change, ESG reporting, and social innovation, her experience spans business, government, academia, and nonprofits. She joined NetApp from VMware, where she held multiple leadership roles, most recently serving as Chief Sustainability Officer. Nicola has a BS from the University of California, Berkeley and was awarded a Commonwealth Scholarship to complete a Ph.D. at the University of East Anglia in the UK. Nicolas charter at NetApp is to further progress sustainability and ESG at NetApp for the benefit of all of stakeholders, building on her career and live-long passion around leveraging technology and innovation to create positive social and environmental impact." DeboAdeniyiCEO and Chief Sustainability/ESG LeadCengssud Sustainability ServicesAs the CEO and Chief Sustainability Officer at CENGSSUD Sustainability Services Ltd (www.cengssud.com), I lead our efforts on sustainability services, solutions and innovation. I manage and lead the company's day-to-day operations to achieve set objectives, targets, and promote the value and collective interests that impact the triple bottom line (People, Planet and Profit). JohnAdlerChief ESG OfficerNew York City Office of the Controller Bjrnge HjlloChief Sustainability OfficerNAVTORge Hjllo's LinkedIn bio states: "Further enhance the concept of Weather-Navigation; i.e. the integration of maritime Electronic Navigational Chart with a high standard and funcitonal weather & routing solution service for Mariners. Taylor and provide a total Weather-Navigation & Operation solution through ECS/ECDIS systems and web based systems

Specialties: Meteorologist with long experience in Marine Weather Industry in combination with detailed knowlegde of commercial shipping industry." RohitAggarwalaCommissioner, Department of Environmental Protection and Chief Climate OfficerCity of New York JavierAguirreCorporate Affairs and Chief Sustainability OfficerAgroAmerica

Aguirre joined AgroAmerica in September 2016 as corporate compliance officer. He shifted to corporate director in 2019. During his time with the company, Aguirre led development and execution of the current sustainability strategy, corporate policies, and compliance initiatives, AgroAmerica noted.

On the academic front, Aguirre earned a master's degree in Sustainability Management from Columbia University in New York.

Khuloud HasanAl NowaisChief Strategy and Sustainability OfficerEmirates Foundation for Youth DevelopmentAl Nowais' LinkedIn bio states: "A member of the senior management team at Emirates Foundation, I lead the research and development of strategies to build the skills and enthusiasm of our youth to take up future leadership positions. We are recognised as pioneers to ensure philanthropic capital creates sustainable socio-economic value." IbrahimAl-Zu'biChief Sustainability OfficerADNOC GroupAl-Zu'bi's LinkedIn states: "As Senior Vice President of Sustainability & Climate at ADNOC Group, Ibrahim oversees the Groups sustainability strategy and performance, and environmental, social and governance (ESG) disclosures and reporting in addition leading the energy transition narrative . Prior to this, Ibrahim was the Chief Sustainability Officer at Majid Al Futtaim Group where he prioritized a Net Positive performance across the Groups operations and raised Majid Al Futtaims sustainability impact and profile in the Middle East and globally.

Author of How to Net Positive, a practical guide for companies embarking on their Net Positive journey, Ibrahims impactful leadership in sustainability has been recognized in the Top 100 Thought Leaders in Europe and the Middle East by Center for Sustainability and Excellence, US. Selected as the 35th sustainability leader out of the top 100 leaders by the Sustainability Magazine - the only one from the UAE and the region and also selected as one of the Top 100 Thought Leaders in Europe and the Middle East by Center for Sustainability and Excellence in the US."

BaderAl khalifaChief Communications and Sustainability OfficerBeyonAl khalifa's Linked bio states: "Communications and Sustainability professional with a total of over 20 years work experience in multiple sectors. Proud member of Beyon Executive Management team and committed to our vision to accelerate the digital future for better lives and prosperity. I am passionate about what I do and love to challenge the status quo and rethink the way we work to push our limits and reach new heights." RaedAlbasseetGroup Chief Environment and Sustainability OfficerRed Sea GlobalAlbasseet's LinkedIn bio states: "Raed joined RSG in May 2018, bringing 20 years of experience in sustainability and environment leadership gained during his roles with various renowned regional and global entities. During his tenure with RSG, Raed has grown a world class team of professionals whilst integrating a bespoke environmental governance and management system and industry-pioneering sustainability targets into the sustainable development agenda. Raed oversees the Groups environment and sustainability agenda in its entirety, as well as provide wide-ranging advice and expertise across the master planning, design, construction and operational phases of The Red Sea, AMAALA and other projects currently under evaluation." NicoleAlderete-FerriniClimate and Sustainability OfficerCity of El Paso, TexasAlderete-Ferrini's LinkedIn bio states, in part: "As a native Texan, I am keenly aware of the inherent strength of communities from El Paso to Houston and back again, as well as the often overwhelming challenges we face. It was that awareness that in part inspired me to study design, architecture and urban planning at Texas Tech University. However, it was my love for community and my passion for making a difference in my home community that inspired me to return El Paso after college. Since returning home, I have launched and maintained my own successful business, founded and grown a local non profit organization, become the City of El Pasos first Chief Resilience Officer and transformed local Community Development strategy as director of the City of El Pasos Community and Human Development Department. I have placed all of my personal and professional energy for over a decade toward an ongoing effort to create a more resilient, equitable and and sustainable communities." MahaAlQattanGroup Chief Sustainability OfficerDP WorldAlQattan's LinkedIn bio states: "Maha AlQattan is DP Worlds Group Chief Sustainability Officer. In this leadership role, she is preparing DP World for a radical shift in how business, and logistics in particular, addresses the great challenges of climate change, education, and social inequality. Maha is committed to ensuring that the business operates in a responsible manner, prioritising sustainability and the impact on the people and communities where DP World operates. She is empowering more than 106,500 DP World employees in 73 countries across six continents to build a smart, sustainable future. Maha joined DP World as Group Chief People Officer in early 2017. This role has influenced her sustainability remit - underlining her commitment to delivering womens education and employment initiatives. Maha is an Executive Board Member of DP World UAE region and Hindustan Ports Private Limited. She also serves as a Non-Executive Board Member for Abu Dhabi Islamic Bank (ADIB), SHUAA Capital, and the Board of Trustees for Universite Pantheon Assas. She has a Master's degree in Industrial and Labour Relations from Cornell University and a Bachelor of Business Administration in Management and Human Resources from the University of Wisconsin-Madison."

AshleyAllenChief Sustainability OfficerOatlyHer LinkedIn bio states: "Environmental sustainability and strategic engagement leader. Advancing climate action and sustainable development around the world." DavidAllenVP of SustainabilityPepsiCo Foods North America

David Allen is VP of sustainability for PepsiCo Foods North America (PFNA), which includes Frito-Lay North America (FLNA) and Quaker Foods North America (QFNA). In this role, he is responsible helping PFNA execute its sustainability vision of building a more sustainable food system and reducing environmental impact. The companys sustainability commitments span six key areas  agriculture, people, water, products, climate and packaging. David began his career with PepsiCo as an engineer in 1996. He then spent the next 20 years in various field manufacturing and distribution roles in multiple locations, giving him significant breadth and depth of supply chain experience. Prior to his current role, David served as the Senior Director of Quality and Food Safety for PFNA. He holds a bachelor's degree in mechanical engineering from Texas A&M University.

MarcAllenChief Sustainability Officer & Co-FounderUnravel CarbonAllen's LinkedIn bio states: "I'm a chemical engineer, specialising in greenhouse gas (GHG), sustainability and renewable energy, with close to 20 years experience in both operational and consulting roles across a wide range of industries including mining, mineral processing, oil and gas and chemicals/heavy industry.

I'm currently working in the greenhouse gas space helping businesses understand the risks of climate change - both from a financial/transition point of view, as well as potential physical risks. This includes development of corporate GHG strategy, risk management for GHG issues, analysis of external factors relating to legislation changes and social license, reporting of energy and emissions, identification/evaluation of carbon and energy abatement opportunities and assisting with the management of carbon liabilities.

I'm also a certified advisory board chair and able to work with businesses to set up advisory boards, helping them navigate changes take advantage of opportunities associated with the energy transition and decarbonisation and avoiding the risks that come with this transformation.

Key skills - business strategy development, climate change strategy, analysis of climate change risk, analysis of climate related opportunities, Implementation of business strategy, advisory boards, mentoring, emissions measurement and monitoring, emissions abatement options, energy efficiency, renewable energy, sustainable development, sustainable development goals, design thinking, system level thinking, circular economy." KathrynAlsegafGlobal Chief Sustainability OfficerDeloitteAlsegaf's LinkedIn bio states: I have been working in sustainability for more than a decade. It started when I submitted an idea to an innovation competition suggesting Deloitte should audit carbon emissions reporting. The idea took. And it took me with it.

I am now Global Chief Sustainability Officer for Deloitte. My responsibilities include oversight and advancement of Deloittes WorldClimate strategy and overall environmental objectives. I am also responsible for Deloittes greenhouse gas inventory, development and tracking of carbon reduction goals, and for external reporting on sustainability (CDP, TCFD, GRI). I have fun working with Deloitte firms and enabling areas to promote greater environmental responsibility and helping ALL Deloitte professionals unleash their superpowers to address climate change.

I am at my best working on first-of-a kind projects where there is no manual. I thrive in my role because it lets me work internationally and inter-generationally. I am continually inspired by my colleagues who bring their expertise, creativity and enthusiasm to work every day.

JessicaAlsfordChief Sustainability OfficerMorgan StanleyJessica Alsford is an Executive Director and Head of Morgan Stanley's Sustainable + Responsible investment research team. Jessica joined the firm in 2005 and spent five years co-heading the Business Services team within Equity Research. In 2010, the team was ranked second in the Institutional Investor and Extel surveys. AhmedAmeen AshourChief Sustainability Commercial OfficerMicrosoft Middle East and AfricaAmeen Ashour's LinkedIn bio states: "Business leader with over 20 years of experience in educational technology (Edtech) across Europe & Middle East region, experienced in driving digital transformation across the Education & Government Industry and the adoption of cloud computing. Proven track record of driving successful strategic public-private partnerships, developing holistic engagements through managing sales, business development, partner management, and go-to-market strategies to achieve market share impact and growth." EstherAnChief Sustainability OfficerCity Developments Ltd.An's LinkedIn bio states: "An active advocate for green building and sustainability for over two decades, Esther has been instrumental in establishing CDLs leadership in sustainability. It is ranked top real estate company on the 2020 Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in the World and is also the only CDP A-List company for climate strategy and water security in SE Asia. Key ESG initiatives she has spearheaded include publishing the first sustainability report using GRI standards in Singapore in 2008; issuing the first green bond by a Singaporean company in 2017 and pioneering an SDG Innovation Loan in Singapore in 2019. As a forerunner in embracing the UN SDGs, Esther was conferred 2018 SDG Pioneer for Green Infrastructure and A Low Carbon Economy by the UN Global Compact. Committed to building a large ecosystem to drive change, Esther serves on the board ad Vice Chair of the World Green Building Council Corporate Advisory Board, Asia Pacific Real Estate Association (APREA), Singapore Institute of Directors and Global Compact Network Singapore. She chairs the ULI Singapore Sustainability Product Council and APREA Sustainability Committee with a view to accelerate sustainability practices in the regional real estate sector. The founder of Women4Green and Youth4Climate initiatives, Esther believes in engaging and empowering women and youths as force for change towards a sustainable future for all." JulietAnammahFormer Chief Sustainability OfficerJumia Technologies AG - ADRAnammah's LinkedIn bio states: Consumer Behavior and Strategic Planning Senior Executive with expertise in global trends analysis, operating model design and execution, and building collaborative partnerships. Eighteen years managing development and implementation of strategic roadmaps, improving competitive positioning and financial performance of consumer goods companies. AndyAndersonChief Sustainability OfficerTangoAnderson's LinkedIn bio states: "Over the past fifteen years, Andy Anderson has become the go-to expert in energy commodity markets, sustainability reporting, utility tariffs, and utility data analytics. Leveraging his futures and options trading experience and Columbia Business School education with a focus on data analytics and decision making, Andy advises some of the largest real estate portfolios across the US and internationally on their sustainability and energy management practices. As Chief Sustainability Officer and EVP, Energy and Sustainability Solutions at WatchWire by Tango, Andy Anderson leads the team in creating, refining, and delivering its industry leading digital energy and sustainability management portal, as well as managing the procurement of ~$1 billion in electricity, natural gas, and renewable energy commodities. Clients throughout North America and >30 countries across various vertical markets such as commercial office, hospitality, and manufacturing/industrial (representing >1.5bn square feet of real estate) lean on WatchWire and Andy's teams for utility data acquisition, auditing and consolidation; benchmarking; measurement and verification; budgeting and variance reporting; and energy risk management. Andy graduated with a B.A. in Economics from Franklin & Marshall College and holds an MBA with Dean's Graduation Honors from Columbia Business School. Andy is a Professor at NYU's Center for Global Affairs (graduate school), teaching Energy and Sustainability Management for Portfolios: Putting Policy into Practice." JenniferAndersonSenior VP, Strategy, Business Development & Chief Sustainability OfficerCarrier GlobalAnderson's LinkedIn bio states: Jennifer leads Carriers environmental, social and governance strategy as the Senior Vice President, Strategy, Business Development & Chief Sustainability Officer. Jennifers team is focused on aligning Carriers vision to create solutions that matter for people and the planet. Before joining Carrier, Jennifer served as senior vice president, corporate development, responsible for strategy, transformation, and mergers and acquisition activities. NoelAndersonChief Sustainability OfficerAmerican Red Cross AllysonAnderson BookChief Sustainability OfficerBaker HughesHer LinkedIn bio states: "I lead our sustainability strategy setting and drive the company's performance in meeting sustainable business outcomes that support and drive our commercial strategy. This work includes emissions quantification for our companies, products and services, and often those of our customer. A strategic aspect of my team's work is to drive market enablement through strong external partnerships and prospective policy creation for energy transition technology." MarkAndertonChief Sourcing and Sustainability OfficerThe Warehouse GroupSee Mark Anderson profile here on Sustainable Tech Partner. EwanAndrewPresident, Global Supply & Procurement; Chief Sustainability OfficerDiageoAndrew's LinkedIn bio states: "Chief Supply Chain Officer for Diageos global operations, technical, engineering, supply chain and procurement teams. Here in Diageo we Celebrate Life Everyday, Everywhere and for me that means leading the teams who - from grain to glass - create, innovate, plan, source, make and move a portfolio of premium and luxury brands to over 180 countries globally. You can see our full portfolio of brands as well as learn a lot more about who we are at https://www.diageo.com - including Johnnie Walker Scotch Whisky, Guinness Beer, Baileys Irish Cream Liqueur, Smirnoff Vodka, Captain Morgan Rum, Tanqueray Gin and Don Julio Tequila." JimAndrewChief Sustainability Officer & EVPPepsiCoJim Andrew leads the PepsiCo global Sustainability Office, focused on the growth and transformation strategy of pep+ (PepsiCo Positive) including integrating sustainability across our brands and business, building the capabilities and partnerships, designing the roadmaps, and executing the programs to transform PepsiCo in the next decade. JanetAnnesleyChief Sustainability OfficerKiwetinohk EnergyLinkedIn bio states: "I help organizations manage 21st century business risks, develop opportunities and engage with their stakeholders." GianlucaAnsaloneHead of Public Affairs & SustainabilityNovartis Lindsay ArellChief Sustainability OfficerASM GlobalArell is well-known for her work at Honeycomb Strategies, a sustainability consulting firm focused on hospitality, sports, and events organizations. Before joining ASM Global as CSO, she led the development of ASM Global ACTS sustainability plan. Key milestones in her career journey include ISO 20121 certifications for Lincoln Financial Field in Philadelphia and SoFi Stadium in Inglewood. Arell also launched the Sustainable Sport Index, a global benchmarking project on the impacts of teams, leagues, and venues, according to her bio. AndreArgentonChief Sustainability Officer and VP of EH&SDowArgenton is responsible for corporate EH&S governance and corporate sustainability, including the reporting and disclosure of Dows ESG performance. Argenton joined Dow in 1999, most recently serving as Vice President of Research and Development, responsible for leading a broad portfolio of research programs and world-leading innovation capabilities. RamonArratiaChief Sustainability OfficerBall Corp.Arratia's LinkedIn profile states: "I advocate for radical sustainability. In a mission to show how sustainability, circular economy and radical transparency will disrupt businesses that do not take it seriously.

Been campaigning for a truly circular economy for over a decade. I believe near 100% true circularity for packaging is possible if policy, product design and recycling infrastructure are aligned. Author of the book 'Full Product Transparency'.

I'm currently promoting satellite monitoring as the enabler for unprecedented transparency on GHGs including methane leakage detection and air pollution. This will disrupt ESG analysis by providing asset-level attribution without the need of corporate reporting. It will also provide the credibility needed for the carbon markets, nature-based solutions, net zero claims. It will provide unimpeachable data for the environmental litigation that is looming.

Senior Associate at the Cambridge Institute for Sustainability Leadership." JasonAshdownCo-Founder and Chief Sustainability OfficerSkylineR. Jason Ashdown ensures that Skyline stands as an industry leader in environmental, social, and economic sustainability, and remains at the forefront of innovation, efficiency, and community service in the Canadian real estate sphere. CatherineAtkinChief Sustainability OfficerRedwoods AI Inc.

As chief sustainable officer (CSO), Atkin will "advance the product strategy and growth for Redwoods.ai and deepen the companys climate-tech capabilities, technology solutions and outreach," the company said.

Atkin is an attorney and expert on global carbon data architecture and GHG emissions policies. In a previous role as director of Carbon Accountable, she developed a legislative proposal and acted as the main technical advisor on Californias recently enacted corporate GHG emissions reporting law (SB 253), the company noted. Atkin also is a Stanford Law School CodeX Fellow and chair of the Climate Data Policy Initiative (CDPI), a project that "brings together climate experts, policy makers and technologists to inform the development of climate data policies with a special focus on how next-gen technologies like AI, IoT and blockchain can accelerate innovation and climate impact," the firm said.

LucyAugust-PernaDirector of Global SustainabilityLive Nation EntertainmentAugust-Perna's LinkedIn bio states: "Sustainability leader with 15+ years experience leveraging the intersection of culture, business, and the environment to drive wide scale social and environmental impact." NicklasAugustssonChief Sustainability OfficerBeckers GroupAugustsson joined the company in 2001 as a development engineer, and has held key positions in sales, research & development, and technical services. He shifted to global sustainability director in 2016, according to LinkedIn. OlgaAulet-LeonESG LeadLucid Motors AmyAvalosSenior VP, Chief Sustainability Business Officer & Corporate SecretaryWorld KinectHer LinkedIn bio states: "Amy Quintana Avalos is Senior Vice President, Chief Sustainability Business Officer and Corporate Secretary of World Kinect Corporation (formerly World Fuel Services Corporation). In this strategic role, Amy is driving the Companys energy transition and corporate responsibility efforts throughout the organization. She is responsible for overseeing the global decarbonization strategy for the Companys own operations and partnering with its business leaders and other stakeholders to support the organizations broader energy transition objectives and ambitions. Amy is also supporting many other environmental, social and governance initiatives, including diversity, equity and inclusion, health and safety, as well as engaging with and supporting the communities in which the Company operates." AngelaAveryGroup EVP and Chief People, Corporate and Sustainability OfficerWestJetAvery's LinkedIn bio states: "As WestJets EVP, Chief People, Corporate & Sustainability Officer, Angela is responsible for the legal, human resources and external affairs of the WestJet Group of Companies. She has 3 decades of commercial and legal leadership experience and has led transactions totalling more than $25B. Angelas international experience includes litigating war reparations at the United Nations in Switzerland and serving as Chief Compliance Officer of a Fortune 100 company in Texas. She is licensed to practice law in Alberta and New York. She serves on the board of Athabasca Oil and previously on the boards of the Calgary Zoo, YMCA and Arts Commons." GwenaelleAvice-HuetFormerly Chief Strategy and Sustainability Officer; now Executive VP of European OperationsSchneider ElectricAvice-Huet's LinkedIn bio states: "As Executive Vice President of Europe Operations and a member of the Executive Committee, l lead Schneider Electric's full business portfolio across Europe, representing the companys contribution to the development of the EUs agenda to accelerate Europes green and digital transformation." EvaAxelssonChief Sustainability Officer and Head of Group SustainabilitySaab RickAxthelmChief Public Affairs and Sustainability OfficerCompass MineralsAxthelm's LinkedIn bio states: "Experienced Public Affairs leader with a demonstrated history of corporate communications, strategic planning and crisis management, public policy development and advocacy." BenjaminAzadaChief Strategy Officer and Chief Sustainability OfficerConverge ICT Solutions IncAzada's LinkedIn bio states; "As Chief Strategy Officer of the country's fastest growing communications service provider, I am responsible for driving key strategic initiatives for the company to accelerate organization performance. I lead also the company's efforts to become a more responsible business and reduce its environmental impact." ShahrilAzuar JiminChief Sustainability OfficerMaybankAzuur Jimin's LinkedIn bio states: "Not a good guitarist, but I try. An even worse drummer, but I try even harder. I have fun along the way, I love doing it, and usually it comes out all right. Story of my life." ElizabethBabcockExecutive Director, Office of Climate Action, Sustainability and Resiliency (CASR)City of Denver Babcock has more than 20 years of experience managing collaborative, equitable and transformational projects, the Mayor's office said. For more than a decade, she has led the City and County of Denver in the development of Denvers climate office, and she created nationally recognized programs under Denvers Climate Protection Fund, the Mayor's office added. StaceyBabson KaplanSenior VP, Chief Sustainability & Compliance OfficerTerex Corp.Babson Kaplan's LinkedIn bio states: "A commercially focused senior business executive with broad international legal, business, and commercial experience and a global mindset, I have a record of delivering value and business growth while effectively managing the risks inherent in a large global, public companys business strategy. My expertise spans corporate law, governance, global trade, ethics and compliance, domestic and international labor and employment, legislative and regulatory matters, strategy, investor relations, and government affairs." StewartBaileyChief Corporate Affairs and Sustainability OfficerAnglogold AshantiStewart Baileys portfolio includes stakeholder relations and the broader ambit of sustainability policy and oversight. He leads a strong team of specialists covering investor relations and communications, alongside the core sustainability disciplines, namely safety, health, environment, community and government relations, and security and human rights. Over 11 years with AngloGold Ashanti, based both in the US and South Africa, he has built in-depth knowledge of the Company and its stakeholders. Mr. Bailey was the senior vice president of investor relations and group communications before he was appointed to his current role in 2019. In his previous role, Mr. Bailey covered debt and equity investors in the US, South Africa, the UK, Europe and Asia, was a key member of the companys team which successfully completed debt issues of more than $3 billion between 2010 and 2019, and was a member of the team that has executed acquisitions and asset sales over that period. He also held line responsibility for AngloGold Ashantis corporate communications programme, which included engagement with financial news media in South Africa, US and UK. He is a former financial journalist with Bloomberg LP in New York and Johannesburg. VijayBainsGroup Chief Sustainability Officer and Group Head of ESGEmirates NBD

Vijay Bains is the first-ever Group Head of Environmental, Social and Governance (ESG) at Emirates NBD Bank, Head Office, Dubai, U.A.E.

Prior to joining ENBD, Vijay was at KPMG in the UK where he has worked across Sustainability, advising client on Sustainable Finance, ESG Strategy, ESG Regulations. He has held roles across other leading organizations like Ernst and Young, Lloyds Banking Group and the European Bank of Reconstruction & Development.

Vijay has extensive experience building and implementing ESG strategies and teams. He has designed and marketed sustainability loans and green bonds, while advising on sustainability for IPOs, as well as designing and building ESG finance products such as mortgages, loans, and insurances

Vijay brings over 15+ years of sustainability experience to the role across the Middle East, UK, Europe, and North America. Vijay is responsible for the end-to-end ESG strategy including the introduction of more sustainable practices, policies, and outcomes across Emirates NBD Group.

He is not only responsible to increase the Banks sustainable finance offerings, investments, provide customers with greater advisory services to support their net-zero transition but also be responsible for the Corporate Governance requirements too. Vijay will significantly increase Emirates NBD Banks sustainability investments across the organization.

Lastly but not the least, Vijay plays a vital role in the Groups journey to embed environmental, social and governance principles across the growing organization and business strategy. This is mission-critical for Emirates NBD Bank in delivering the vision and purpose in a sustainable way.

AylaBajwaSenior VO of SustainabilityDP WorldBajwa's LinkedIn bio states: "As Founder of Ampuz, Ayla has used her background in sustainability to fuse the worlds of tech and sustainability to create a solution that help organizations measure and report on their impact. She assists companies, universities, charities execute best practice in line with their values, impact areas, national priorities while minimizing their reputation risk and legal liabilities." AngelaBakerVP and Chief Sustainability OfficerQualcommAngela Baker's LinkedIn bio states: "A dynamic sustainability and social impact leader with over 15 years of experience in international strategic planning and program management. Expertise includes ESG reporting, climate change strategy, board governance, sustainability and social planning focused on business integration, leading multiple teams, , and developing action plans. By designing global initiatives focused on issue awareness and community empowerment, I cultivate lasting partnerships and a collaborative environment to support ongoing development. In addition, heavy emphasis on both internal and external communications around company wide goals, disclosures and programs." MichaelBaldingerChief Sustainability OfficerUBSBaldinger's LinkedIn bio states: "I am the Chief Sustainability Officer for UBS. In this role I am responsible for setting and driving the implementation of our sustainability strategy.

Before being appointed to this role I was Head of Sustainable and Impact Investing at UBS Asset Management, where I led a team of dedicated investment professionals focused on research and stewardship, client solutions and business strategy. Together we built on UBS' long-term commitment to be the leader in sustainability investing by providing innovative and tailored solutions for our clients.

I represent UBS Group as a Board Member of Swiss Sustainable Finance, and as President of the Swiss Banking Association EC. I have more than 30 years of experience across the financial industry and over a decade of expertise as a sustainability investor including my previous role at RobecoSAM as CEO and Chairman of the Executive Committee. I evolved from a short-term proprietary trader in my younger years to a "long-term value creation" sustainability investing advocate." MarciaBaliscianoChief Sustainability Officer, Global Head of ESG and Corporate ResponsibilityRELXBalisciano's LinkedIn bio states: "Achievements in sustainability, ESG, corporate responsibility, corporate affairs, operations, governance, international relations, stakeholder and media engagement, arts and heritage." JeffreyBallChief Sustainability OfficerCSLBall has been at CSL since 2019 in various leadership roles and has played a vital part in the evolution of CSL's Sustainability Strategy, including the establishment of governance structures like the Executive Sustainability Committee, which is comprised of several cross-functional senior leaders from across the CSL enterprise and is responsible for setting the Sustainability Strategy and its day-to-day management and execution. As Chief Sustainability Officer, Ball will continue these responsibilities whilst overseeing the expansion and operationalization of key sustainability targets and initiative Lee F.BallChief Sustainability OfficerAppalachian State UniversityAccording to his LinkedIn bio: I have a doctorate in Sustainability Education, a master's degree in Environmental Education, and a bachelors degree in Natural Science. I am currently the Chief Sustainability Officer at Appalachian State University. Prior to this, I spent fourteen years teaching sustainable building design in Appalachian State University's Department of Sustainable Technologies and the Built Environment. My scholarly and professional interests focus on nature based solutions, sustainability leadership, sustainability literacy, resilience, biophilic/ecophilic design, regenerative design, decarbonization, climate justice, and change agency related to community engagement. WayneBaltaFormer Chief Sustainability Officer (Retirement: June 2024)IBM

Wayne S. Balta is set to retire in June 2024. Christina Shim has been named successor as chief sustainability officer.

Balta was Vice President of Corporate Environmental Affairs and Product Safety at IBM Corporation and had been the companys Chief Sustainability Officer. He has global responsibility for environmental affairs, energy efficiency, and toxicology and chemical management as well as product safety and related hardware compliance functions. He joined IBM in 1984.

In addition to his role as IBMs chief environmental executive, Mr. Balta is a member of IBMs Acceleration Team  a group of the companys top leaders that drives company-wide innovation and growth. A 36-year veteran of IBM, he has served on IBMs Global Enablement Team for Kenya and East Africa and is IBMs Partnership Executive for Carnegie Mellon University.

Mr. Balta has played a leadership role with a variety of organizations. He has served as Vice Chairman of the Board of the Environmental Law Institute and as Chairman of the Board of the World Environment Center. He has been a member and past Chairman of The Conference Board's Chief Environment, Health & Safety Officers Council. He is a member of the Governing Consortium for the UN Environment Programmes Science Policy Business Forum. He serves as a member of the Sustainability Advisory Board for the Smeal College of Business at Penn State University and has served on the Strategic Advisory Council for the University of Michigans Erb Institute for Global Sustainable Enterprise.

Mr. Balta was elected to the National Academy of Engineering in 2019 and serves on its Civil Engineering Peer Committee. He received the inaugural Lifetime Achievement Award from the National Association for Environmental Management in 2018. He was named a White House Champion of Change in 2012 for his efforts to advance corporate environmental sustainability.

Mr. Balta received a Bachelor of Science Degree in civil engineering with University Honors from Carnegie Mellon University in 1982, where he now serves on the Deans Advisory Council for the College of Engineering. He was the recipient of Carnegie Mellon Universitys Distinguished Alumni Service Award in 2009. Mr. Balta also earned a Master of Science Degree in civil engineering from the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (where he was a Tau Beta Pi Fellow) in 1984.

The Honorable Meredith Berger assumed the responsibilities of the Assistant Secretary of the Navy for Energy, Installations & Environment on July 28, 2021.
